alert.note: Alert for Bradley; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BRADLEY AND WESTERN POLK COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over South Cleveland, or near Cleveland, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Benton, Charleston, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, Calhoun, Waterville, Conasauga, and Parksville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
